TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TextMarkerStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the appearance of a list item's bullet style.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List.MarkerStyle%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> can be used to define the bullet style for each item in the list. The bullet style can be a graphic element or an alpha-numeric value.
## Examples The following code example shows how to create a <xref:System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle>.
[!code-csharp[TextMarkerStyleSnippets#TextMarkerStyleSnippet1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/TextMarkerStyleSnippets/csharp/window1.xaml.cs#textmarkerstylesnippet1)] [!code-vb[TextMarkerStyleSnippets#TextMarkerStyleSnippet1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/TextMarkerStyleSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#textmarkerstylesnippet1)] [!code-xaml[TextMarkerStyleSnippets#TextMarkerStyleSnippet1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/TextMarkerStyleSnippets/csharp/window1.xaml#textmarkerstylesnippet1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle Box = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A solid square box is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle Circle = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A hollow disc circle is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle Decimal = int32(9)

Docs.summary: A decimal is displayed, starting with the number one, for example, 1, 2, and 3. The is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle Disc = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A solid disc circle is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle LowerLatin = int32(7)

Docs.summary: A lowercase [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ascii](~/includes/tlasharptla-ascii-md.md)] character is displayed, starting with the letter a, for example, a, b, and c. The is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle LowerRoman = int32(5)

Docs.summary: A lowercase Roman numeral is displayed, starting with the numeral i, for example, i, ii, iii, and iv. The is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle Square = int32(3)

Docs.summary: A hollow square shape is displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle UpperLatin = int32(8)

Docs.summary: An uppercase [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ascii](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ascii-md.md)] character is displayed, starting with the letter A, for example, A, B, and C. The is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle UpperRoman = int32(6)

Docs.summary: An uppercase Roman numeral is displayed, starting with the numeral I, for example, I, II, III, and IV. The is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.
